dublinCore.dc:title: 115 HR 3191 IH: No Cyber Cooperation with Russia Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Brendan F. Boyle of Pennsylvania (for himself, Mr. Ted Lieu of California, Mr. Gallego, Mr. Engel, Ms. Rosen, Mr. Evans, and Ms. Clarke of New York) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs

form.official-title: To prohibit the use of Federal funds to establish, support, or otherwise promote a joint cybersecurity initiative with Russia, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the No Cyber Cooperation with Russia Act.

section.header: Prohibition on use of Federal funds for joint cybersecurity initiative with Russia
section.text: No Federal funds may be used to establish, support, or otherwise promote, directly or indirectly, the formation of or any United States participation in a joint cybersecurity initiative involving the Government of Russia or any entity operating under the direction of the Government of Russia.
